alert.note: Alert for Kodiak Island (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Wind Warning issued March 01 at 4:07PM AKST until March 02 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM AKST THURSDAY... * WHAT...West winds 35 to 55 mph with gusts up to 80 mph. * WHERE...Kodiak Island. * WHEN...Until 6 AM AKST Thursday. * IMPACTS...High winds may move loose debris, damage property, and cause power outages. Travel will be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Strong winds will reach peak intensity this evening. Winds should then gradually diminish into the overnight hours. The combination of intermittent snow showers or snow on the ground with the strong winds may cause blowing and drifting snow. Visibility reductions to one half mile will be possible, but are anticipated to be infrequent.
info.instruction: People are urged to secure loose objects that could be blown around or damaged by the wind. Prepare for the possibility of widespread power outages. Use caution if you must drive.
